intro: Lupinus wilkesianus, commonly known as the Kenyan lupin, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its tall, erect growth habit and clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces cylindrical pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Lupinus wilkesianus is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
